action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I'll start with the word "crane" as it contains a mix of common consonants and vowels.
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = idiot
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: None of the letters in "crane" are in the target word. I'll try "stomp" next, as it contains a different set of common letters.
guess: stomp

attempts = 2
target_word = idiot
guess = stomp
guess_feedback = s<red> t<yellow> o<yellow> m<red> p<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> t<yellow> o<yellow> m<red> p<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t" and "o" are in the word but in the wrong position. I'll try "today" to test if "t" and "o" can be in different positions.
guess: today

attempts = 3
target_word = idiot
guess = today
guess_feedback = t<yellow> o<yellow> d<yellow> a<red> y<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> o<yellow> d<yellow> a<red> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t," "o," and "d" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I'll try "dotty" to see if these letters can fit in different spots.
guess: dotty

attempts = 4
target_word = idiot
guess = dotty
guess_feedback = d<yellow> o<yellow> t<yellow> t<red> y<red>

guess_feedback: d<yellow> o<yellow> t<yellow> t<red> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "d," "o," and "t" are confirmed to be in the word but not in the positions tested. I'll try "tooth" to see if "t" can be the first letter and "o" the second.
guess: tooth

attempts = 5
target_word = idiot
guess = tooth
guess_feedback = t<yellow> o<yellow> o<red> t<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> o<yellow> o<red> t<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t" and "o" are confirmed but not in the first two positions. I'll try "bloat" to test new letters "b" and "l" and reposition "t" and "o".
guess: bloat

attempts = 6
target_word = idiot
guess = bloat
guess_feedback = b<red> l<red> o<yellow> a<red> t<green>

guess_explanation: I'll start with the word "crane" as it contains a mix of common consonants and vowels.
None of the letters in "crane" are in the target word. I'll try "stomp" next, as it contains a different set of common letters.
"t" and "o" are in the word but in the wrong position. I'll try "today" to test if "t" and "o" can be in different positions.
"t," "o," and "d" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I'll try "dotty" to see if these letters can fit in different spots.
"d," "o," and "t" are confirmed to be in the word but not in the positions tested. I'll try "tooth" to see if "t" can be the first letter and "o" the second.
"t" and "o" are confirmed but not in the first two positions. I'll try "bloat" to test new letters "b" and "l" and reposition "t" and "o".
